intro: Aegiphila loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
